title: What's News --  Business & Finance
text:
The across-the-board rise in commodity prices at levels not seen since the start of the financial crisis is casting a cloud over the global economic recovery, slamming vulnerable businesses and households and adding to fears that inflation could become more persistent.

---

Jeff Bezos plans to travel to space next month as part of the first crew carried by Blue Origin, the Amazon founder's space company.

---

Google agreed to pay French regulators a fine of nearly $270 million, settling one of the first antitrust cases globally that allege the tech giant abused its leading role in the digital-ad sector.

---

Apple said it would introduce later this year more features to help iPhone users control how third parties use their data.

---

Construction startup Katerra, one of the bigger investments in SoftBank's Vision Fund, filed for bankruptcy protection in the U.S.

---

The Dow briefly entered record territory before retreating to close down 0.4%. The S&P 500 fell less than 0.1% and the Nasdaq gained 0.5%.

---

HSBC said its Asia-Pacific CEO, Peter Wong, is retiring and it has appointed two veteran bankers to run its business in the region.

---

SoundPoint struck a deal to buy the U.S. direct-lending arm of Luxembourg-based CVC Capital Partners.

---

Blackstone struck a roughly $6.7 billion deal to buy QTS and take the data-center operator private.
